html: 2.4.23  1:53 pm   Is music what words feel like

2.4.23  1:27 pm   i wanted to ask a question and also share something with you

it seems that you did things by starting out with something you know you can do, like the early monday videos, and the early songs like "hi bye". i tried this, and i kinda liked doing it this way , but im so impatient and i keep wanting more more more more more, knowing i can't do much more - so instead ive been trying a different approach, which is the act like i'm a raytracing engine, where my first attempt is all encompassing, and grand in scope, but blurry and messy and noisy, and not good. then my second attempt is like a second pass, filling in some details, and making something less chaotic, and more understandable, then after many attempts, i start to fill in the holes and get the details down and make something better. have you ever at any point tried doing things this way?

      is there a name for that type of growth?


also i hope your work is going well! and i hope you are well, and i hope you are joyful today!

2.3.23  2:10 am   bill i had a dream that was very similra to a memory from childhood (a good one) and all day ive been trying to remember that memory and its like 90% gone. I remember some places of that week, but aside from that I can't remember much. it's like at this point i miss remembering those things more than i miss those things, and it feels new and old at the same time? It's like I miss the idea of those memories more than the actual memories. in a sense it made me realize that i'll probably slowly start forgetting about today and closer days further in the future. Do you feel it too? Is art how you deal with that?

     is listening to music how you make this portals in the now to go back to in the future?

      Is it okay to forget some good times if I dont forget that they were there?
